rfp_title: Cheshire and Warrington Outline Energy Plan
description:
ECW, on behalf of and in coordination with Cheshire West and Chester, Cheshire East, and Warrington Borough Councils, is seeking to appoint consultancy support to produce a Cheshire and Warrington Outline Energy Plan;  providing the evidence base to support  local growth ambitions and investment pipeline development, support future spatial development work in Cheshire and Warrington, and support engagement in the NESO Regional Energy Strategic Planning (RESP) process. This commission will provide a strong local evidence base for current and future demand, and build the case for investment in energy infrastructure to support both local growth ambitions and commitments in our Sustainable and Inclusive Economic Strategy to support the local energy transition and government ambitions for Clean Power by 2030.

Clean Energy is one vital component of Cheshire and Warrington growth ambitions, with unique existing (e.g. VisNet, Gas Storage Facilities) and upcoming (e.g. HyNet, HALEU) infrastructure providing substantial opportunities for us to pioneer approaches to clean power and industrial decarbonisation. This infrastructure will support wider growth opportunities, ensuring that Cheshire and Warrington is an attractive location for housing growth, business development, and reindustrialisation.  To better grasp this opportunity, it is vital we:
1.	Better understand our baseline energy demand.
2.	Have access to light-touch scenario planning to anticipate the likely changes to generation and demand over the next 5-10 years.
3.	Can clearly and consistently produce early evidence for RESP, DSO, and NGET to secure strategic reinforcement to grid.
4.	Understand the integration of different energy transition vectors across the C&W landscape.
5.	Can drive investment to strategically vital energy projects in Cheshire and Warrington that support wider economic development.
This commission will provide the foundation for attracting inward investment in Cheshire and Warrington
competitor_recommendation: No competitor signals detected. Neutral competitive landscape.

rfp_title: Invitation to a Preliminary Market Engagement Event - Wrap Around Service
description:
Sandwell Metropolitan Borough Council (SMBC) are currently exploring options for the future procurement of a Sandwell Wrap Around Service. The primary objective of this service is to reduce hospital delays, prevent unnecessary long-term care placements, improve independence outcomes, and provide coordinated, person-centred support that enables multidisciplinary assessment and intervention to take place in appropriate settings.
      
      The service will deliver a wrap-around model of care, offering 24-hour care and support where required, alongside agreed multidisciplinary team input, for individuals awaiting assessments or longer-term care provision. Support will be tailored to individual need and a safe transition of care.
      
      The service will be provided for people whose assessed level of need can be safely and effectively supported outside of an acute hospital environment and where those needs may not be appropriately met within the individual's own home or usual place of residence without additional coordinated support.
      
      The Sandwell Wrap Around Service will help maintain capacity within the Borough of Sandwell for a short-term, up to 72 hour period, supporting hospital avoidance for individuals living in the community. The service will support people who are medically stable but require further assessment, monitoring, or intervention before a long-term care decision is made.
      
      Eligibility for the service will include adults aged 18 years and over who are residents of Sandwell.
      
      This preliminary market engagement seeks to understand supplier capabilities and challenges, gather feedback, and inform the development of the future procurement of the Sandwell Wrap Around Service.
      
      This will take place on Wednesday 4 March 10am - 11am for all interested organisations.
       
      Please email by Monday 2 March 11am rupi_deo@sandwell.gov.uk your full name, job title, organisation, email address
competitor_recommendation: No competitor signals detected. Neutral competitive landscape.

description:
For the past few years, CPC has outsourced the contract management of its Cashless Payment Solutions framework agreement for various reasons, one of which being capacity internally. We are now looking to bring this framework back in-house and this tender exercise will form the new iteration of the framework. 

Suppliers must be capable of delivering high-quality, cost-effective Electronic Payment Devices, Software and Professional Services to institutions such as schools, academies, colleges, universities, and educational trusts, as well as local authorities and the wider public sector. 

CPC will be using the MultiQuote e-Tendering platform to carry out this tender. In order to express your interest in this tender and obtain the tender documents, please register or log in at: https://suppliers.multiquote.com/Page/Login.aspx If you have any issues when using MultiQuote, please contact Elcom Ltd on 020 3920 8054 or email support@elcom.com

To access this competition: 

Registered:
Login to https://suppliers.multiquote.com and view the opportunity CA17224.

Not registered:
Visit https://suppliers.multiquote.com then register and quote CA17224 as the reason for registration. 

 Any queries please contact MultiQuote on 0151 482 9230.

rfp_title: Emergency Transfer Ambulance Support for the Helipad Project at Ysbyty Gwynedd
issuing_entity: NHS Wales Shared Services Partnership-Procurement Services (hosted by Velindre University NHS Trust)
description:
Betsi Cadwaladr University Health Board (BCUHB) is seeking to appoint a single regulated supplier to deliver a dedicated emergency ambulance support service to facilitate patient transfers between the Alternative Landing Site (ALS) and Ysbyty Gwynedd during a temporary helipad infrastructure project.
 The requirement is for the provision of a double-crewed Advanced Life Support (ALS) capable emergency ambulance, operating between 09:00 and 23:00, seven (7) days per week, for an anticipated period of 30 weeks. The appointed supplier must ensure the safe and timely transfer of patients conveyed by Helicopter Emergency Medical Services (HEMS), including those presenting with time-critical and high-acuity conditions.
 The service must be fully compliant with all relevant regulatory requirements, including HIW registration (or equivalent where applicable), medicines management controls, clinical governance standards and infection prevention requirements. The supplier must demonstrate appropriate staffing competence, operational resilience and integration with local emergency care pathways.
competitor_recommendation: No competitor signals detected. Neutral competitive landscape.

rfp_title: FDIS - Wittering External Refurbishments to 32 properties - FY2026/27 - Amey Central Region - East Midlands & Nth
description:
Central Region - East Midlands & North
Brief Scope of Works
•	Replace all windows with PVCu
•	Replace main entrance door with composite 
•	Replace secondary entrance door with PVCu
•	Helifix and lintel repairs
•	Redecs to main entrance door surrounds
•	Remove and replace all timber store doors/replace with PVCu
•	Redecs to external meter boxes
•	Shared On Site Liaison Officer
Amey have been tasked by the DIO through the FDIS to deliver the RAMS for the C & N Regions.
This notice is a call for competition and there may not be a further notice related to this opportunity.
For Amey to accept any EoI it is ESSENTIAL that any subcontractor is:
•	willing to act as Main Contractor (essential requirement);
•	a Verified member of Constructionline (GOLD), relevant Work Category MUST show that Subcontracting is possible, and the 'BSA - Standard Construction' must be Verified;
•	capable of working to MOD SFG20 (PPM works only);
•	capable of working in a BIM Level 2 environment (where applicable);
•	compliant with DefStan 05-138 (required if you are likely to handle MoD Identifiable Information on your IT system);
•	willing to work with Amey to deliver Social Value to our Client; ideally, comp lete the Social Value Goal within the Constructionline platform.
DESIRABLE attributes of our Supply Chain:
•	have a Corporate Social Responsibility policy;
•	have a Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Plan
If successful the subcontractor will need to pass a PQQ, sign up to Amey Terms and Conditions, and meet the MoD Security Requirements. 
This future opportunity notice is for Expressions of Interest, BY EMAIL ONLY. 
Procurement Documentation will follow separately via a link from our e-tender portal (Curtis Fitch).
Note 1: The bidder must quote for all aspects of the Works.
Note 2: Future works of a similar nature may be negotiated based upon submitted rates.
Note 3: Those making an Expression of Interest will be required to sign-up to our 'Sub-contract Ag
competitor_recommendation: No competitor signals detected. Neutral competitive landscape.

description:
1. Overview
The works comprise the supply and installation of steel sheet piling to support temporary and permanent structures across the A66 NTP Project, BBA Section 3b.

2. Detailed Scope
2.1 Supply of Materials
The Contractor shall supply:
•	Steel sheet piles in various profile sizes, complete with corrosion protection and cut to length requirements.  
2.2 Installation of Sheet Piles
The Contractor shall undertake:
•	Pile installation works including driving, vibration, pre drilling, cutting, interlock connections, tie rods, waling and bracing systems. 
•	 Removal of sheet piles upon completion of works. 
2.3 Associated Works
The Contractor shall complete associated activities including:
•	Pile guide frames
•	Dewatering screens
•	Structural support components
2.4 Pre Construction & Site Activities
Activities include:
•	Mobilisation and site establishment
•	Setting out
•	QA testing
•	Preparation of record drawings and certification
2.5 Coordination Requirements
The Contractor shall coordinate with related project disciplines including foundations, drainage and earthworks teams. 
________________________________________
3. Standards & Compliance
All works must be carried out in accordance with:
•	BD 21/01
•	National Highways Specification
•	Relevant BS/EN/Eurocode standards
•	CDM Regulations

________________________________________
4. Key Supplier Requirements
The Contractor must:
•	Demonstrate capability to manage CDM and SHES risks 
•	Provide method statements, vibration and noise mitigation plans 
•	Coordinate closely with Temporary Works Designers
•	Collaborate with the Balfour Beatty site and engineering teams 
•	Submit all required QA documentation, including testing and certification evidence 
________________________________________
5. Procurement & Delivery Model (Informational Context Only)
A competitive tender process will be conducted to select a single supply and install partner for consistency, scalability an

rfp_title: CA17253 - RFQ 2025/62 - PEACEPLUS Cross-community Festival Programme Celebrating Languages Together
issuing_entity: Newry, Mourne and Down District Council (NMD)
description:
Newry Mourne & Down District Council's PEACEPLUS Action Plan includes the delivery of Collaborative Interaction Programmes under Strand 2 - Thriving and Peaceful Communities. Strand 2 focuses on eight identified priority projects encompassing a broad range of initiatives focused on capacity building, leadership development, cross community relationship building interaction and engagement, social and emotional support, events and festivals and community justice interventions.

Under the programme area of Events & Festivals designed to celebrate the area's diverse range of communities, arts and cultures a range of cross-community festivals will be delivered celebrating the diverse range of language communities


To access this competition: 

Registered:
Login to https://suppliers.multiquote.com and view the opportunity CA17253.

Not registered:
Visit https://suppliers.multiquote.com then register and quote CA17253 as the reason for registration. 

 Any queries please contact MultiQuote on 0151 482 9230.
